trans-unit.source: Add alternative text to an image
This module provides you the possibility to add an alternative text to images. It shows only images without an alternative text jet.

An alternative describes the content of an image. This text should always be set. Mainly because of the following two reasons: Search Engines With an alternative text the image can be indexed by Search Engines like Google. People with handicaps The alternative text can be read by screen readers. So people with handicaps get also an idea what is displayed. Module Functions On top you can directly edit the file metadata of the current image, get more information about it or view it in a new tab. Moreover you get information about the current path, enter this help or create a shortcut to this module. You can also toggle if you want to see pictures of the current folder or also of subfolders. If you entered an alternative text and press save, you see the next image which misses an alternative text, if there is one.
